channel.title: vSphere on @PSUStevens Blog
channel.description: Recent content in vSphere on @PSUStevens Blog

item.title: How to Update Esxi 7.0u3d to 7.0u3k using vSphere Lifecycle_Manager
item.description: Recently, I ran into an issue where I really needed to get my vSphere homelab upgraded to version 7.0U3k. More on why this was so urgent in a future post. However, I was still back on 7.0U3d. To get to 7.0U3 I used vSphere Lifecycle Manager (vLCM). In case you missed it, vSphere Lifecycle Manager is built into vSphere 7. If you aren’t familiar with vLCM, then you can read more about vSphere Lifecycle Manager over here: https://blogs.
